page.title: 05The Forge
page.content: The forge in Daglingworth village has been there for many years. The two blacksmiths who work there are brothers. The tools they use are very much the same as those which have been used for centuries past. In the past the blacksmiths used to do ornamental work but now they are too busy shoeing horses to do any thing else. People who live near by can bring their horses to the forge but most of the farrier's work is done near the stables where the horses live. They are mainly hunters, children's ponies and polo ponies. Daglingworth farriers are so skilled that they were chosen by the Sultan of Brunei to teach his people how to shoe polo ponies.
